reviews.review_msg: The best courses have an instructor who is passionate about the subject material and also cares a lot about their students' learning. We grappled with difficult texts, a pandemic shutting down in-person classes and even a snow day but Dr. H. R. was cheerful, accessible and flexible. A really kind and knowledgeable prof - would definitely recommend!

Very friendly and approachable. Her grading criteria is clear and fair, and essay feedback is detailed and useful. She was very helpful and worked hard to make things easier during the covid-19 shutdown. I would definitely take another course with Sarah.

Dr Sarah Rossiter's class was great. Passionate profs are the best profs and medieval phil is her bread and butter. She's great at clarifying things and admits when she doesn't know an answer but will get back to you to clarify later. I would definitely take another class taught by her again.

I had never taken a class on Eastern philosophy and was scared I wouldn't understand anything. Nicolas explained everything in such a way that even someone who doesn't do philosophy would understand. He's a great professor who obviously loves what he does, and is extremely knowledgeable in his field. I would recommend taking any class with him.
Great lecturer, difficult marker, cool guy. Made a difficult topic accessible and interesting through his lectures. Worth taking.

Very inspired professor; genuinely likes teaching and shows it.  Has a lot of knowledge of Greek history and the milieu in which western philosophy was birthed. Make sure you understand standard form arguments: you will be required to put arguments into standard form.  Overall a great guy, fair marker, knowledgeable and clear professor.

Phil Hanson is easily the smartest professor up at SFU (which is not as big a deal as it may sound).  I found him extremely helpful, profoundly knowledgeable, and fostered a real interest in me for Leibniz.
